title.rendered: Compology’s Jason Gates on Waste Monitoring and Reduction

content.rendered:
Jason Gates, CEO of Compology, is taking the recycling battle to the dumpster. Compology makes AI-powered smart cameras that monitor how full dumpsters are and help understand and manage what they contain. The process reduces unnecessary pickups, which lowers fuel waste and improves the processing of the contents of each bin.

In this episode of the Earth911 Podcast, Compology CEO Jason Gates explains how Compology cameras work, the six types of contamination they can spot and how the bin user gets alerts. Also discussed is the possibility of the system tracking food waste and helping divert it to composting programs in the future. Jason and host Mitch Ratcliffe also discuss the security and privacy benefits of monitoring waste to prevent confidential data from being exposed. Listen to the full episode here:

Listen to “Earth911 Podcast:Compology’s Jason Gates on Waste Monitoring and Reduction” on Spreaker.
